intro: Chrysopteris lepidopoda, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, typically growing on the branches of host trees. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered together. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy, red berries. Chrysopteris lepidopoda plays a role in ecosystem dynamics by influencing host tree growth and providing food for various wildlife species.
